definition: the six spirits that rule the vital organs (heart 心[xin1], lungs 肺[fei4], liver 肝[gan1], kidneys 腎|肾[shen4], spleen 脾[pi2] and gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3])

sentences.english: The effect ol' Liu Shen Wan (LSW) on the ultrastructure and function of the zonafasciculata of adrenal cortex was observed in this study.
sentences.chinese: 观察了六神丸对肾上腺皮质束状带形态与功能的作用。

sentences.english: He went to pieces when they told him the tragic news.
sentences.chinese: 人们告诉他那悲惨的消息后，他已六神无主了。

sentences.english: Objective To establish the methods of TLC identification of Liushen Qushu lotion.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立六神祛暑水的薄层鉴别方法。

sentences.english: Six absolute beings that seven treasures scare were ownerless, entirely had not mind.
sentences.chinese: 七宝吓的六神无主，完全没了主意。

sentences.english: Mr. Slope had thus left her quite bewildered.
sentences.chinese: 因此，斯洛普先生离开她的时候感到六神无主。

sentences.english: These year, I guard in this small noodles building, of be let he 6 absolute beings are uneasy.
sentences.chinese: 这些年，我守在这个小面馆，要的就是让他六神不安。

sentences.english: Having heard such news, he was frightened out of his sense.
sentences.chinese: 听到这个消息后，他吓得六神无主。

sentences.english: The poor boy was on tenterhooks when his father was searching for a stick.
sentences.chinese: 那个可怜的男孩见父亲到处找棍子，感到六神无主。

definition: perfumed toilet water/eau de cologne/floral water/hydrosol
essential balm containing menthol, eucalyptus oil etc, used as a mosquito repellant
秦越人[Qin2 Yue4 ren2] (407-310 BC), Warring States physician known for his medical skills, nicknamed Bian Que after the earliest known Chinese physician allegedly from the 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] era
Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
same as Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 (369-286 BC), Daoist author
Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil
Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)
Marco Polo (1254-c. 1324), Venetian trader and explorer who traveled the Silk road to China, author of Il Milione (Travels of Marco Polo)
